paper_metadata.title: Teaching to Fish or Providing Fish: China's 'Targeted Poverty Alleviation' in the Tibetan Pastoral Areas of Qinghai Province

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: direct distribution of money, grain, objects of utility, or even houses, have been the predominant methods aimed at improving the socioeconomic situation of households in Tibetan pastoral areas of western China

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: the officials fall back on the method of constructing new houses and distributing them among the rural population

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The Targeted Poverty Alleviation program should once again accomplish China's fight against poverty through countryside reforms
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: In the spring of 2017 the Jingzhun fupin caused a commotion in rural Qinghai

bonus_information.qualitative_evidence_citation: In the spring of 2017 the Jingzhun fupin caused a commotion in rural Qinghai, especially among the officials invested with the task of eliminating poverty by 2020

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: the latest ambitious program of the current state-initiated rural development program of Targeted Poverty Alleviation-the Jingzhun fupin 精准扶贫
evidence_citations.country_citation: in the Tibetan pastoral areas of Qinghai itself
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: the rural population of the Tibetan pasturelands
